page.title: 08FORESTRY
page.content: FORESTRY. THE WOODLANDS AROUND HORSFORD ARE PART OF WENSUM FOREST. MOST OF THE SOIL IS OF THE POOR TYPE OF SAND AND HARD GRAVEL. ORIGNALLY MUCH OF THE FOREST WAS OF MIXED . WOODLAND CONSISTING OF OAK ELM ASH ALDER BEECH AND A FEW PINE TREES. MUCH HAS NOW BEEN REPLACED WITH CONIFERS CONSISTING MAINLY OF SCOTS AND CORSICAN PINE. THE WOODS BETWEEN HORSFORD AND ST FAITHS ARE MANAGED BY THE FORESTRY COMMISSION ON A LEASE FROM THE BARRATT LEONARD ESTATE. ACCESS IS NOT ALLOWED ON THE AREA BETWEEN HORSFORD AND FELTHORPE, KNOWN AS ST FAITHS COMMON, WHICH IS MORE VARIED WITH MIXED WOODLANDS. INTERSPERSED WITH BELTS OF VARIOUS CONIFERS. VARIOUS FOOTPATHS GIVE ACCESS TO THIS AREA A FOREST NURSERY AND A FIRING RANGE COME WITIN THE WOODED AREAS.
